title: SaaS Forge Kit
description: Modern, production-ready Next.js SaaS boilerplate with auth, optional billing, and deployment-ready setup.
longDescription: A Next.js SaaS blueprint designed to be cloned and extended for SaaS ideas, portfolios, and experiments. Includes PostgreSQL + Prisma, Tailwind + shadcn/ui, Better Auth (email/password + optional Google OAuth), optional Stripe billing, TypeScript + Zod validation, and Docker Compose for local DB.

title: Ce ne manca uno
description: Location-based sports meetups: create games, find players nearby, and fill spots fast.
longDescription: A responsive, installable PWA born from a real need: helping people find players nearby for sports like 5-a-side football. Users can post events with missing players, location, date/time, skill level, and minimum age. The app supports install on mobile, push notifications via service worker (e.g., when someone joins your event), and private event comments visible only to participants, including reactions.

title: Six Degrees of Separation: Optimizing BFS (CS50AI)
description: Applied AI engineering project: BFS optimization for the CS50AI “Degrees” problem with benchmarks and notebook.
longDescription: Based on Harvard CS50 Introduction to AI with Python. Implements and benchmarks an optimized BFS strategy for the “Six Degrees of Separation” problem, preserving correctness and shortest-path guarantees. Includes code, datasets, and a Jupyter notebook with analysis.

title: Check Certification
description: Frontend project using Atomic Design, Tailwind, and shadcn/ui; includes an email reminder flow via Supabase cron + Resend.
longDescription: A TypeScript frontend structured with Atomic Design for maintainability. Tailwind for responsive styling and shadcn/ui for UI components. Includes notes on automated email reminders (Supabase scheduled job + Resend).

title: YanchGo
description: Angular CLI project with OpenAPI mock server and documentation generation workflow.
longDescription: Angular 17 project with local dev server, OpenAPI mocker server (port 1234), and documentation generation via Compodoc.
